title: Advanced Linux Incident Response
subtitle: Live forensics, memory analysis, rootkit detection, and incident containment on Linux systems
learning_objectives: Perform live response on compromised Linux systems
Acquire and analyze memory dumps using Volatility
Use DFIR tools for Linux investigations

content.text: Advanced incident response combines forensics, threat hunting, and containment. When a Linux system is compromised, you must act quickly to preserve evidence, understand attacker actions, and contain the breach without alerting the adversary.

post_assessment.question: What is the first step in live response on a potentially compromised system?
options: Document current state and collect volatile data
post_assessment.explanation: Volatile data (memory, network connections, running processes) is lost when the system powers off. Document and collect this first before taking any other action.
post_assessment.memory_aid: Volatile first - memory evaporates when power is lost
